intro: Brachyloma delbi, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy-bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, typically arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Brachyloma delbi is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
